Brittany Harris (L) and Demetrius Dennis (R) are charged after a 4-year-old was found to be in possession of a gun after another child was shot inside a home in St. Louis (Credit: SLMPD).
ST. LOUIS, Mo. (KMOV.com) – Two adults have been charged after a 4-year-old was found to be in possession of a gun after another child was shot inside a home in St. Louis.
The 5-year-old was shot once in the torso while inside a home in the 2800 block of Stoddard Street, just north of Dr. Martin Luther King Drive, around 7 a.m. on September 10.
Police said the child’s mother, Brittany Harris, 24, and her boyfriend, Demetrius Dennis, 25, originally stated the child was playing outside when they heard a gunshot. When police investigated further, they found out the child was shot while inside the residence.
Police believe the child may have been shot by a 4-year-old who was found to be in possession of an unsecured firearm.
The child was listed in stable condition at a local hospital following the incident.
Child abuse investigators responded following the incident.
Police said Harris was charged with endangering the welfare of a child. A judge ordered a $10,000 or 10 percent cash-only bond.
Dennis is also charged with endangering the welfare of a child and unlawful possession of a firearm, according to police. He is being held on a $40,000 cash-only bond.
